edu.isep.sixcolors.controller

Class Play

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.isep.sixcolors.controller.Play

  •  class Play
extends java.lang.Object
    The main controller of Six Colors, it is view-generic. All the game mechanic related tests are here, the information for these tests are sent in by an OutputInfo when it requests the control method This class changes the Game model

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private Game game

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private Player checkForWinner()
      Returns the winner or null if there is none yet
      private void colorButtonPressed(java.lang.String sourceActionCommand)
      Receives tries to parse a String to a TileColor, if valid, it updates the currentPlayer's current TileColor, then updates the board, and checks if a winner has risen if not it's the next player turn
      void control(java.lang.String sourceText, int boardSize, int playerNb, java.lang.String[] playerName, java.lang.String[] playerType, java.lang.String sourceActionCommand)
      Linchpin method in testing the inputs from the view accordingly to the current game state, partially tests some in-method, most tests are done in auxiliary methods in Play
      private void initGrid(int boardSize, int playerNb)
      Initialises after checking validity the Grid model and it's size & the Player model and the number of players, into the Game model
      private boolean initPlayers(java.lang.String[] playerName, java.lang.String[] playerType)
      Initialises the Player models in Players model in the Game model after testing their validity

    • Method Detail

      • control

        public void control(java.lang.String sourceText,
           int boardSize,
           int playerNb,
           java.lang.String[] playerName,
           java.lang.String[] playerType,
           java.lang.String sourceActionCommand)
        Linchpin method in testing the inputs from the view accordingly to the current game state, partially tests some in-method, most tests are done in auxiliary methods in Play
        Parameters:
        sourceText - The text of input
        boardSize - The size of the board
        playerNb - The number of players
        playerName - A table of the player's names
        playerType - A table of the player' what the player is (what AI or human)
        sourceActionCommand - The text sent as an Action Command, must not be mixed up with sourceText, usefull when more than one information must be conveyed at once

      • initGrid

        private void initGrid(int boardSize,
            int playerNb)
        Initialises after checking validity the Grid model and it's size & the Player model and the number of players, into the Game model
        Parameters:
        boardSize - The size of the board
        playerNb - The number of players

      • initPlayers

        private boolean initPlayers(java.lang.String[] playerName,
                  java.lang.String[] playerType)
        Initialises the Player models in Players model in the Game model after testing their validity
        Parameters:
        playerName - A table of the player's names
        playerType - A table of the player' what the player is (what AI or human)
        Returns:
        a boolean reflecting if an empty name was entered

      • checkForWinner

        private Player checkForWinner()
        Returns the winner or null if there is none yet
        Returns:
        Player winner or null;

      • colorButtonPressed

        private void colorButtonPressed(java.lang.String sourceActionCommand)
        Receives tries to parse a String to a TileColor, if valid, it updates the currentPlayer's current TileColor, then updates the board, and checks if a winner has risen if not it's the next player turn
        Parameters:
        sourceActionCommand - the inputted color to be parsed then processed
